about_the_game:
The European Rabbit is a social and territorial animal known for living in large underground burrow systems called warrens. Recently, an expansive network of warrens was discovered near the crop fields in the Hirschfelden Hunting Reserve in Germany. This DLC is free for owners of theHunter: Call of the Wild™.

A GAME OF HIDE-AND-SEEK


The European Rabbit is often sighted looking for cover and food sources in areas where human activity is present, such as pastures and crop fields.

It lives in burrows and spends roughly half of its time below ground. It has an excellent sense of smell to detect threats, and when exposed in the open, which is typically during dawn, afternoon and dusk, it is constantly aware of its surroundings.

EMBRACE THE CHASE

Considering the vigilant nature of the European Rabbit, it may prove challenging for hunters to catch sight of in the terrain of Hirschfelden. However, should you spot one, there are seven fur variations present: Common, Light Grey, Brown, Light Brown, Melanistic, Leucistic, and Albino.

name: theHunter: Call of the Wild™ - Free Species: European Rabbit

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS *: 64bit OS - Windows 7
  • Processor: Intel i3-4170
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GTX 660 / ATI HD7870 - 1GB VRAM
  • Storage: 60 GB available space
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: 64bit OS - Windows 10
  • Processor: Intel i7 quad-core
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVidia GTX 760 / R9 270x - 4GB VRAM
  • Storage: 60 GB available space

short_description: The European Rabbit, an invasive species of Rabbit native to southwestern Europe and northwest Africa, can now be added to the game with this free DLC.
supported_languages:
English*, French, German, Portuguese - Brazil, Russian, Spanish - Spain, Czech, Polish, Simplified Chinese, Japanese
*languages with full audio support
